Spiked Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate

Jump to Recipe

Indulging in a rich, decadent drink is one of the simple pleasures of life, and nothing says comfort quite like a Spiked Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate. This delightful concoction is the perfect blend of creamy milk, heavy cream, and luxurious semi-sweet chocolate, elevated by the addition of luscious salted caramel sauce and a splash of your favorite liquor. Whether you're enjoying a cozy evening at home or entertaining friends during the chilly months, this recipe promises to warm your heart and tantalize your taste buds. With just a few ingredients and easy steps, you can create a gourmet hot chocolate experience that is both satisfying and sophisticated. Join us as we dive into this irresistible treat that combines the sweetness of caramel with a hint of sea salt, topped off with fluffy whipped cream for an unforgettable finish. Get ready to impress your guests or simply treat yourself to the ultimate winter beverage!

Ingredients

milk

Use whole milk for a creamier texture; skim milk can be used for a lighter version. For dairy-free options, almond milk, oat milk, or coconut milk can be substituted, but they may change the flavor slightly.

heavy cream

If you want to reduce calories, you can substitute half-and-half or a lighter cream (like light whipping cream) but note that it will be less rich. For a dairy-free option, coconut cream can be a great substitute.

chocolate chips (semi-sweet)

If you prefer a darker chocolate flavor, use dark chocolate chips instead. You can also chop up a chocolate bar for a richer taste. For a sweeter flavor, milk chocolate chips can be used.

salted caramel sauce

Store-bought is convenient, but homemade caramel sauce can enhance flavor. If you want to make it less sweet, use less caramel or try a sugar-free version.

vanilla extract

Use pure vanilla extract for the best flavor. If you're out, vanilla bean paste or even a drop of almond extract can add a unique twist.

whipped cream

You can make homemade whipped cream for a fresher taste, or use canned whipped cream for convenience. For a flavored option, try adding a bit of cocoa powder or vanilla to the cream before whipping.

sea salt

A pinch of flaky sea salt enhances sweetness. If you don't have sea salt, kosher salt works too, but avoid table salt as it can be too fine.

your choice of liquor (e.g., bourbon or rum)

Bourbon adds a warm, caramel flavor, while rum adds a tropical touch. If you prefer a non-alcoholic version, you can omit the liquor or use a flavored syrup to mimic the taste.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Combine Milk and Heavy Cream

    In a medium saucepan, combine 2 cups of milk and 1/2 cup of heavy cream over medium heat. Stir occasionally to prevent scorching.

  • Step 2: Heat Mixture

    Continue to heat the mixture until it starts to steam, but do not let it boil. This should take about 5-7 minutes.

  • Step 3: Add Chocolate Chips

    Once the milk and cream are heated, add 1 cup of semi-sweet chocolate chips to the saucepan. Stir consistently until the chocolate is fully melted and the mixture is smooth.

  • Step 4: Incorporate Salted Caramel and Vanilla

    Stir in 1/4 cup of salted caramel sauce and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Mix well until fully incorporated, ensuring the caramel is dissolved into the chocolate mixture.

  • Step 5: Add Liquor

    Remove the saucepan from heat and add your choice of liquor (1-2 oz, such as bourbon or rum). Stir gently to combine.

  • Step 6: Serve the Hot Chocolate

    Pour the spiked salted caramel hot chocolate into mugs. Make sure to leave some space at the top for whipped cream.

  • Step 7: Top with Whipped Cream and Garnishes

    Generously top each mug with whipped cream. Drizzle extra salted caramel sauce over the whipped cream and sprinkle a pinch of sea salt for an added flavor contrast.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I properly measure liquids like milk and cream?

Use a liquid measuring cup for accuracy. Ensure you’re at eye level with the measuring cup to check the measurement. Pour the liquid until it reaches the desired line.

How can I melt chocolate chips smoothly?

Melt chocolate chips over medium heat, stirring frequently. If you want to avoid burning, you can also use a double boiler or microwave in short intervals (30 seconds), stirring in between.

What can I use instead of salted caramel sauce?

You can make a quick caramel sauce by melting sugar until golden and adding a bit of butter and cream. Alternatively, try using chocolate syrup for a different flavor.

How do I prevent my hot chocolate from curdling?

Heat the milk gradually and avoid boiling it. Stir frequently to keep the milk from scorching at the bottom.

What is the best way to top whipped cream on hot chocolate?

Use a spoon or a piping bag to dollop or pipe whipped cream on top of your hot chocolate. For an extra touch, you can sprinkle cocoa powder or chocolate shavings on top.

How do I choose a liquor for my hot chocolate?

Bourbon and rum are popular choices for spiked hot chocolate. Choose a liquor you enjoy drinking on its own for the best flavor.

Can I make this recipe in advance?

Yes, you can prepare the hot chocolate mixture ahead of time. Just reheat gently on the stove when you’re ready to serve, adding the liquor just before serving.

How do I make whipped cream from scratch?

Chill a mixing bowl and beaters, then use heavy cream (1 cup) and 2 tablespoons of sugar. Whip until soft peaks form. Be careful not to overwhip!

What should I do if my hot chocolate is too thick?

If it’s too thick, simply add a little more milk or cream until you reach your desired consistency.

How do I clean up sticky caramel spills?

Dissolve the caramel residue by soaking it with warm water and dish soap. A gentle scrub will help remove any remaining stickiness.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a dairy-free alternative, substitute milk and heavy cream with almond milk or coconut cream, and use dairy-free chocolate chips. To make it vegan, opt for a vegan whiskey or rum. Adjust the amount of salted caramel sauce to suit your sweetness preference, and consider using a low-sugar or sugar-free sauce for a lighter variant.

Pairings

For a delightful pairing, serve Spiked Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate with spiced rum or bourbon for a cozy, warming drink. Complement it with a slice of rich chocolate cake or chewy caramel brownies to enhance the chocolate and caramel flavors. For a lighter option, consider pairing with spiced nuts or a cheese platter featuring sharp cheddar to balance the sweetness.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the hot chocolate in festive mugs, garnished with a generous swirl of whipped cream and an additional drizzle of salted caramel sauce. For an extra touch, use a sprinkle of cocoa powder or crushed graham crackers on top of the whipped cream. This drink is best enjoyed warm, ideally around 150°F (65°C). Consider serving it alongside a cozy throw blanket and some holiday-themed decorations for a comforting atmosphere.

Ingredients
